intro: Sorindeia obliquifoliolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sorindeia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, opposite leaves with a distinctive asymmetrical shape. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, producing a pale yellow to white coloration. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils in woodland or savanna habitats.
